item.title: Martin Van Buren National Historic Site Boundary Revision Act

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on National Parks, Forests and Public Lands.

item.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 984.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported by Senator Bingaman with amendments. Without written report.

item.title: S. 2535, Martin Van Buren National Historic Site Boundary Revision Act
item.description: Cost estimate for the bill as reported by the Senate Committee on Energy and Natural Resources on September 16, 2008

item.title: S. 2535, Martin Van Buren National Historic Site Boundary Revision Act
item.description: Cost estimate for the bill as reported by the Senate Committee on Energy and Natural Resources on September 16, 2008

summary.text:
Martin Van Buren National Historic Site Boundary Revision Act - Adjusts the boundary of the Martin Van Buren National Historic Site in the state of New York to include approximately 261 acres of land identified as the "PROPOSED PARK BOUNDARY" as depicted on the "Boundary Map, Martin Van Buren National Historic Site," dated January 2005.

Authorizes the Secretary to acquire such lands and interests from willing sellers.

Martin Van Buren National Historic Site Boundary Revision Act - Adjusts the boundary of the Martin Van Buren National Historic Site in the state of New York to include approximately 261 acres of land identified as the "PROPOSED PARK BOUNDARY" as depicted on the "Boundary Map, Martin Van Buren National Historic Site," dated January 2005.

Authorizes the Secretary to acquire such lands and interests from willing sellers. Requires land acquired for the Site to be administered as part of such site.

Authorizes appropriations.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
